e4: Adopting the new policy aligns with ethical transparency in financial reporting, avoiding potential legal consequences and building trust with investors by reporting actual earnings. This clarification gives an equal footing to all investors devoid of second-guessing reported figures or relied-upon assumption across narrow attentions specifics.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should provide transparency, accuracy, and honesty, ensuring stakeholders have a true picture of financial performance without manipulations or biases. It should consider protecting all investors fairly, maintaining trust, and compliance with legal requirements to guard against liabilities. Ethical consideration should also balance short-term results with long-term integrity and sustainability of investor-relations resources.
e6: Yes. I would ask how they plan to communicate the policy change to ensure all investors, including retail ones, understand the shift. I would also inquire about any anticipated financial impact and what measures are in place to address potential stock market reactions.
